medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at age 30 with pain in both knees, degenerative changes noted. At age 34, underwent surgery for a unilateral cataract. At age 35, developed a chronic ulcer on the right elbow. By age 38, had a total knee replacement, which had to be removed 2 months later due to septic arthritis. At age 43, progeroid features were observed.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Unilateral cataract surgery at age 34, chronic ulcer on right elbow, total knee replacement at age 38 with subsequent removal due to septic arthritis.
medical_history.family_history: No family history of similar disorders; mother in good health, fatherâ€™s clinical information unavailable, one healthy 15-year-old son.
